definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

sentences.english: that people in the next room have complained lately.
sentences.chinese: 他打呼嚕太響最近連隔壁房間的人都抱怨。

sentences.english: Sharing a bed with a partner who tosses and turns or kicks or snores can give you just as much trouble falling asleep.
sentences.chinese: 如果伴侶睡覺總是翻來動去或打呼嚕，那也真夠鬧心。

sentences.english: Or maybe a pretty tabby cat purring on your lap?
sentences.chinese: 還是一隻可愛的虎斑貓在你大腿上打呼嚕？

sentences.english: If you are snoring, then you cannot be dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 如果你正在打呼嚕，那麼你就沒在做夢。

sentences.english: He flattened his ears, closed his eyes tighter and pretended to snore .
sentences.chinese: 他豎起耳朵，眼睛閉得更緊了，假裝打起了呼嚕。

sentences.english: You know how it is with snoring.
sentences.chinese: 你知道它打起呼嚕來是什麼樣。

sentences.english: Kittens learn how to purr when they are a couple of days old.
sentences.chinese: 幼貓在幾天大的時候就學會發出呼嚕聲了。

sentences.english: And it wasn't just any snore. It was more like a herd of elephants running through the room!
sentences.chinese: 那哪是呼嚕啊，簡直就像一羣大象從屋子裏跑過。
雖然醉鬼酣睡又打呼嚕。

sentences.english: Sometimes he would even wake himself up. He snored so loud!
sentences.chinese: 有時候他的呼嚕太響，把自己都吵醒了。

sentences.english: Hold him by the nose, dearie, then he'll splutter and wake up.
sentences.chinese: 捏住他的鼻子，阿妹，他就會呼嚕呼嚕地醒過來。

sentences.english: Hold him by the nose, dearie, then he'll splutter and wake up.
sentences.chinese: 捏住他的鼻子，阿妹，他就會呼嚕呼嚕地醒過來。

sentences.english: No, Comrade Li, we don't snore; and we don't fart either.
sentences.chinese: 不，李同志，我們不打呼嚕，而且連屁也不放。

sentences.english: My pa has snored disease, how should use spirit way to be being pressed aerate cure?
sentences.chinese: 我爸有打呼嚕的病，要怎麼利用氣道正壓通氣治療？

definition: (onom.) to rumble (of a stomach)/to coo (of a dove)/rumbling/noisy drinking sound
the person who shares your bed/partner/spouse
variant of 冷戰|冷战[leng3 zhan5]
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
